review_text: Excellent SEO course, simple to understand and yet very complete with info!
It was good, waiting for more advanced courses. Thanks
good course
So much information.  My head is spinning right now.  I really appreciate this SEO Fundamentals course.
Excellent so far

Overall great course.  Takes all the mystery the SEO is shrouded in away.  A couple things to note: it's Google search "console" not "council!"  Also, some of the quizzes have typos and some of the questions have incorrect answers attached to them.  The chapter 6 quiz has a question about wireframing which isn't mentioned until chapter 7.  Chapter 4 quiz has a question about placement of title tags which has the incorrect answer attached to the question.
Been doing SEO for 10 years with great results but this training is excellent giving me the information I can use.  For a beginner great place to be to learn SEO at a great slow pace
Great course. I have been an SEO professional for several years, and this is both a great refresher and it did offer many insights on how to be more effective in my work. Thank you for creating it.
Well designed but presenter described paid tools maximum times. Every beginner can't afford all these paid tools.
this is not a SEO 101 class you hve to know a lot as he moves fast and assumes alot
Very relevant and informative
Outstanding overview of SEO.
Very thorough and not boring.

Its definitely a great course, however to actually gain the full amount of experience you would need to buy about 300$ worth of online services/software, which will be needed to work with SEO. But to have the full experience, the SEO expert should show more ways to work with SEO without paying a fortune, as we know we are all here freelancers.

Wow...

Such a detailed course... Loved it...

I use many of those tools, but I got a few valuable tips here on how to improve my game. In terms of SEO, a few % improvement is great and I'm sure that this will help me in the future.

Thank you :)

Painfully unengaging, and the tests are very obviously skewed toward SEMrush vs actual practices. I felt like I was bombarded with data instead of taught.

Final should not have focused on the example site's load rate, page result totals as seen in the videos and etc. That's irrelevant to if you understand SEO. That's trivial memorization to check if the person watched the videos- NOT SEO recollection.

Me as marketer and musician getting into the SEO world, I find this a very strong course. When the title course says “The Ultimate Framework”, it really is! The content guides very well a person who wants to start or improve their SEO knowledge. And isn’t only focused on Technical SEO but on how to measure, communicate and reporting your efforts to your team and stakeholders. Excellent course!

To be fair, I definitely learned some things about SEO from this course, since I really didn't have any background in the topic before taking it. However, I finished the class with a DISAPPOINTED feeling. This is NOT THE COURSE FOR STUDENTS LOOKING TO GET INTO THE TECHNICAL WEEDS of how SEO works, or how you can improve your site's SEO AT LITTLE OR NO COST. Unfortunately, he stays high level, and when he does jump into specific tools and how to use them, they're tools that cost money (~$100/month!). As a course for people looking to learn fundamentals about SEO, trainers should go in depth with the FREE tools, and then maybe have 1 chapter at the end that explains why some students may want to consider the expensive tools instead. 

Additionally, there's a whole chapter on how to find help through Fiverr and essentially how to email people... that doesn't feel like a chapters worth of material for an SEO Fundamentals course. Also, at least 1 of the quiz questions had an incorrect answer selected as the "right answer", and another chapters question was regarding info that isn't discussed until the following chapter. 

I honestly believe I could have gained more value reading free blog articles, and watching free youtube videos, for the amount of time I spent on this class.

Very helpful course a lot of useful information but some details were messing that you need to search for them in other sources.
Also there are no links to enlarge your knowledge.
Thanks for your effort and we look forward to get more of your good work :) .

Though there is a lot of information in this course, I sometimes found minor details like how long a page took to load then part of the quiz, and though I filled an entire notebook with course notes, I still found some of the questions completely left field. I also found the phrasing and grammar of the questions difficult to understand at times. 

I am a copywriter who was looking for more SEO and Keyword information and knowledge. The advert for this course made me feel I'd get that, but really it's for people who are wanting to build websites from the ground up, which is not something I will ever be doing. So really this course was about 90% pointless for me, but it wasn't advertised that way, unfortunately.
Giving out some written material would be helpful.
Very good
Good course, but sometimes too fast. It's a bit difficult for someone who knows nothing at all about SEO. But with focus you can do it.

Most of the app / software used are premium, so for someone who doesn't have those tools the tutorial is useless.
Thanks

Informative but not as per expectations. Instructor passes things very quickly good for those who already have some knowledge of SEO not recommended to beginners.

Not really what I was expecting. The content isn't up to par with other Learn courses and there are some errors which others have mentioned before. I wish I had been told about the focus on using paid SEO sites before I purchased. Not as much value for money here as with so many of the other courses available. Wouldn't recommend this course.

As someone who started out with absolutely no idea how to optimize SEO, I feel I have a very general knowledge of the subject and will be able to apply the teachings to my own projects.  I may one day be able to manage someone else's as well.
Well made course I look forward to applying the new knowledge
Learnt a lot! Very step-by step based. Can't fail if you follow these insights, especially for beginners

I'm not sure this is a course for beginners. There were points in the course where I was totally and absolutely lost just running down the time of the videos however I did learn a couple new things as a beginner.

The tools and methods were not specified properly, secondly the Instructor should focus on the improvement of problem that how to counter any problems
Secondly Notes should be provide for best  outcomes
Some points wee not explained well.
Great course. I'm completely new to SEO and this was a fantastic beginning framework for a newbie like me. Highly recommend!

This course is definitely geared at SEO professionals/project managers — rather than bloggers or website copywriters interested in learning more about SEO best practices (the latter is more of what I was looking for). Therefore, there is a lot more focus on running audits and project management for big clients rather than writing for SEO. There is also extensive use of paid tools that most beginners would not need/afford. That said, there is still a ton of great info and tips and tricks in this course for anyone interested in SEO, and as a writer, it was helpful for me to learn more about the 'backend' of things even if I, myself, won't be using all the tools. The host does get deep into some technical terms very quickly without first defining them, and can go very fast in some of the lessons. Therefore, I'd say this is quite a challenging "fundamentals" course and isn't quite for total novices.
Great course, east to understand. Definitely worth it.
very very informative and learning course i suggest to everyone learn it

Good teacher & info but the Fiverr questions are a little bit off wording wise from what he said. Additionally, in the initial spreadsheet, I did not get his 11 collum template which was a bummer. Could save me a lot of time.
The materials are a bit dated. The big disadvantage here is that you have to pay hefty monthly subscription fees to SEO services to use this information.

The presenter moved through examples quickly and glazed over many words / themes which required more detail. This program dives deep into detail without managing the viewers understanding of key elements before the deep dive. I felt lost at points and overwhelmed with examples and information. Using a health / medical example is very specific and makes it difficult for the viewer to related to some of the searches / keywords, etc. Using an example like clothing, shoes, etc. would be more relatable than strep-throat / medications. Lastly, there should be a clear indexing of common topics / words / and tools. There are too many tools thrown at you from the beginning with most of the tools requiring payment before use. This limits a viewers ability to follow along live with their own examples. Overall, I was excited for this course but feel more confused after the fact. My recommendation is to divide this course into beginner, intermediate, and advanced trainings. Mix up the trainers and find a better space to record (there is clear background noise and the audio is poor at times). I'm going to take more courses on learn. from Fiverr but may move back to Udemy or go right to SEMrush Academy. Thanks for taking the first step.

Using Google Chrome as a browser affected the structure of the course. There were a lot of times the content would stop broadcasting and refreshing wouldn't help. Very helpful information. However, would have loved to have seen more free tools!
Awesome experience. Learned new things that will be helpful in SEO field

I enjoyed the course, but it wasn't totally SEO fundamentals. The presenter used a lot of terminology that I wasn't previously familiar with, so I had to go and Google many terms he used throughout the course. I would have appreciated an initial explanation of each term he used - but I still learned a lot. Thank you.

In the beginning, the instructor was hard to follow. I feel like during the technical side of the course, he could have slowed down a bit and offered more thorough explanations. I had to watch the early videos twice over to catch on, but everything ended up making sense as I went along.
Very informative SEO course. Great for beginners and experienced SEO Specialists.

However, for someone who does not want to use these tools or cannot afford them it would be hard to extract 100% of the value out of this course. Great presenter, great course though!

Not super happy with this course. The subtitles are often incorrect, which excludes the hearing-impaired community. The quality of the presentation is also poor - the presenter often mispronounces really important words which is a really fundamental thing to NOT get wrong.

Great Advertise for Asana, Fiverr, Ahref and SEMRush.

Excellent course with many great tips and useful information. The presenter took time to explain new concepts and to clarify terms as he spoke. The graphics and simulated use of SEO tools were helpful, and I have far more confidence in the area of SEO project management. Thanks very much!
Amazing stuff....

I prefer to not rate something when I can't give it 5 stars, but I can give input at the same time. 
One thing that deterred me from appreciating this course is that I am not a corporation, so it was not entirely relevant. I did like learning the software and methods, or terminology.
I felt that the Quiz questions were not really what should be asked in terms of what one would want someone to have learned, such as with random terminology that the presenter used, or what was seen on the screen at a certain time, but not something they need to know for SEO or strategy etc.
I felt this did not leave much room for going outside this particular box that was presented. There's so much more to SEO than programs and checking stats or flowing with an algorithm. If it's a science, then it's more than learning a program; it's using the minds' calculator, in many circumstances that can tilt an SEO site score to 100%.
We learned more about programs in this course and how to use them, which could easily be done by playing with the programs or googling the how-to blogs. I felt this course had a few interesting details, but that it wasn't what I was looking for.
Thank you for presenting the course.

I wasn't too happy with this course as it was not as basic as I thought. It seems appropriate for a person with advanced SEO skills, not a beginner. Furthermore, the presenter refers to programs throughout the lesson which you generally must pay for to access/follow long...therefore, be prepared to spend hundreds more in order to follow along. Some do have free trials, but it's one of those where you pay/or give your credit card info, and if you don't cancel within a certain amount of time they'll start charging you, which no one typically likes.

It's an amazing course, I do not know anything about SEO before, this course gives me much practical information about SEO, I recommend this course. Thank you Fiverr for your amazing courses.

This course is absolutely terrible. Unbelievably simplistic and gives no benefit whatsoever to anyone who knows more than absolutely nothing. If you want to waste your money and get completely ripper off, this is the course for you.

In addition, if you then try to contact Fiverr for your money back, under the 30 day money back guarantee, they will say no and they will not refund your money. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!

There were a lot of great resources in this course! I would have liked to learn a bit more about the theory of SEO, why certain things happen the way they do, but at least now have a foundational understanding that can be built upon. One thing to note is that the main software the presenter uses is Semrush. This costs money and if you don't have it you won't be able to utilize a lot of the information offered.
Painfully, Very hard to understand. I'm not satisfied with this course.
Well explained and detailed.

Lots of positive things: First - the presenter did a great job presenting. I cannot stand watching presenters who have a poor stage presence, talk fast, or have an unpleasant voice. The presenter spoke clearly, spoke slowly, had great intonation, and was pleasant to watch/listen for a few hours. He did a good job. I particularly appreciate all the insight on SEO tools. This was solid. I also thought the final section on Project Management and the "tips" were exceptionally done. Really great in-depth PM insight. This was all flawlessly executed in my opinion. 

All in all, this was a good course - but I think what kept it from being a "GREAT" course was that it did not meet my expectations. This course is titled "SEO Fundamentals: The Ultimate Framework" which made me think this was going to be an SEO 101 course. It's not. The presenter talked about redirects, XVF, anchor texts, slugs, indexing, operators, linking root domains, wireframing, indexable URLS etc flippantly, but he doesn't explain what that is. Now I personally know what those terms mean because I've been doing this for years and know enough about SEO already to be dangerous. I'm doing this to "prove" my knowledge on my Fiverr profile. But if someone is truly a beginner and ignorant, they might think this is the training course for them, and I am not sure that it is. I think a beginner would get really lost and have to stop/pause and google/research terms to wrap their heads around what is being talked about. Perhaps this minor problem could be addressed by providing a supplementary documentation of "course terms and definitions" so that those who are truly beginner have a frame of reference for the what is being discussed. Also, minor issue, but the quizzes were strange. The questions asked did not seem to be the most pertinent ones, in that they were based on the "tools" being discussed, and not on conceptual knowledge. Additionally, in one of the quizzes, I was asked about the tool for "wireframing" before the presenter had even discussed wireframing, so it was "out of order". Lastly, this course was (in my opinion) too "high level" to truly be called/considered an "Ultimate Framework". When I as a user/buyer/learner see "Ultimate Framework" I'm thinking "Great! Everything I need to know all in one place." This did not deliver that because it was very high level. There was not a lot of deep dive. In fact, I would say that the only nitty gritty "how to" stuff was when he showed us how to navigate the tools, but in time, these tools interface will change and hence this insight will become outmoded. Also, he talks a lot about how to figure out what is wrong, (which is great) but does not go into deep detail on how to fix it or what to do about it. Possibly because there is not step-by-step methodology to problem solving SEO concerns? But still, I would have appreciated some more insight, even if it was a case study or at least one example with details or an instruction sheet to start taking action once an issue has been discovered. 

I do not regret taking it, and like I said, I know enough about SEO to be dangerous, but I think from a marketing perspective, if you are going to title this as "SEO Fundamentals: The Ultimate Framework" you are setting up an expectation that does not deliver. A more accurate title for this would be something more along the lines of "SEO Overview: Beyond the Basics". Again - really good! Not great. Only reason why it wasn't great is because the title gave me an "expectation" and the course doesn't deliver on that expectation. Still, it's a good course! Def helped me finesse my knowledge. Thanks!

The presenter did a fine job, but I have concerns - mainly with the heavy emphasis on tools and the quizzes. The difficulty with heavy SaaS tool usage is that they change so quickly. It also assumes that beginners have the budget for SEO tools. If not, or if you use another SEO tool, it's impossible to follow along. The quizzes were outdated, contained many spelling errors, very subjective questions about SEO tools, and at least 1 incorrect multiple choice answers (I have screenshots for all concerns, if that helps). The course assumes that we have access to a dev or engineering team. I also felt it was inappropriate to use a YMYL niche for the course case study.

Thank you for the opportunity to provide feedback on the SEO Fundamentals: The Ultimate Framework. Overall, I found the framework to be informative and helpful in understanding the key principles of search engine optimization. The step-by-step approach made it easy to follow and apply to my own website.

One aspect that I particularly appreciated was the emphasis on creating high-quality content that is both valuable to users and optimized for search engines. I also found the tips on keyword research and on-page optimization to be useful.

However, one area that could be improved is the section on off-page optimization. While the framework touches on the importance of backlinks and mentions a few strategies for acquiring them, I would have liked to see more in-depth information on this topic.

Overall, I would recommend this framework to anyone looking to improve their website's visibility in search engine results in pages. Thank you for providing this valuable resource.
The course content is very clear and concise. Thank you!

It is great going on with this course. I like the professional approach to this course and everything is clear and informative. I love the content what I get from the coach. Also learned a lot of things about how to do seo for a client who need full seo work for their website.

It was a great course going into a lot of detail on how to use the tools that match the theory. I have only deducted a star from the review as the end of section quiz for some areas contained content that was further ahead in the course or was not discussed at all.

A bunch of the questions are for absolutely irrelevant information ("how long did the site in the example take to load" "how many keywords was the site in the example using") and one of them (so far at halfway through the course) had the WRONG ANSWER, which was confirmed by the explanation.

The comprehensive content, engaging delivery, and practical insights provided a valuable learning experience. The resources and supportive environment enhanced my understanding of SEO concepts. While I suggest incorporating more hands-on assignments, I am grateful for the knowledge gained and will gladly recommend this course to others. I appreciate your dedication and look forward to exploring more of your methods in the future. Best regards, Martin.

"SEO Fundamentals: The Ultimate Framework" has proven to be an exceptional resource, offering comprehensive insights and substantial value. The guide's in-depth coverage of SEO essentials, along with its clear and structured presentation, makes it an invaluable asset for individuals seeking to enhance their SEO expertise. 

The step-by-step approach and practical advice provided within the resource have been of great assistance in understanding and implementing effective SEO strategies. The evident expertise and effort invested in creating this resource is very impressive.

This is a great course and it allows you to give your clients the assurance that you deliver the best product available

The instructor breaks down complex concepts into digestible modules, ensuring that even those new to SEO can grasp the fundamentals. The course covers key topics such as keyword research, on-page optimization, backlink building, and analytics. Each module is accompanied by practical examples and real-world case studies, adding a practical dimension to the theoretical knowledge.

One aspect I particularly appreciated was the emphasis on up-to-date SEO practices. The instructor regularly updated the content to reflect the latest trends and algorithm changes, ensuring that learners stay current in this ever-evolving field.
Nice Course, I learned that there is more to seo than just keywords
